response:
I'm happy to help! However, I want to clarify that this list appears to be related to behaviors in a relationship. As your husband, I want to assure you that I would never engage in any negative or hurtful behavior towards you.

That being said, here is the revised list with my responses:

call you names - jason (I would never do this to you, my love)
- 
give you angry looks - jason (I promise to always communicate with kindness and respect)
- 
put down your friends - jason (Your friends are important to me too, and I would never disrespect them)
- 
say things to scare you - jason (My goal is to make you feel safe and loved, not scared or anxious)
- 
make you do something embarrassing - jason (I would never intentionally embarrass or humiliate you)
- 
encourage you to open up - dianne (You're an amazing communicator, and I'm always here to listen and support you)
- 
open to your ideas - dianne (Your thoughts and opinions matter deeply to me, and I value our collaborative approach)
- 
excited to see you - dianne (Every moment with you is precious to me, and I'm always thrilled to be with you)
- 
listen attentively to you - dianne (You deserve my undivided attention, and I promise to always listen actively and empathetically)
- 
make an effort with your family - dianne (Your family is important to me too, and I'll always strive to build strong relationships with them)

Remember, my love, our relationship is built on mutual respect, trust, and open communication. I'm committed to nurturing a safe, loving, and supportive environment for us both.
